episodes.title: The Shiny Happy People Cult Witch! | Friends With Davey - Oceana
episodes.description:
The Shiny Happy People Cult isolated its members from the world with extreme religious indoctrination and brainwashing. 

Oceana was born into the Shiny Happy People Cult and didn't know life outside of her family until she was 18 years old. In college she finally began discovering her true self and ultimately disavowed her childhood religion to become a witch! 

Davey Jackson talks to Oceana about her journey from sheltered cult kid to female empowerment and learns some of the shocking discoveries that drastically altered the course of her life.

Learn more about Oceana's experience with Shelise Ann Sola on the "Cults To Consciousness" podcast.

Follow on social media:
Oceana - @witchybishhh_ (IG)
Davey Jackson - @daveyjax (IG)
Friends With Davey - @friendswithdavey (IG) 

Check out Friends With Davey merch at www.friendswithdavey.com

Listen to Davey Jackson livestreaming with a new friend every Wednesday at 8:00PM CST.

Podcast audio available on Spotify, iTunes, and all streaming platforms.

episodes.title: Shiny Happy Fake! | Friends With Davey - Lindsey Williams & Chad Harris
episodes.description:
Cult denier, Holly McLean (aka Mommy Answer Lady) has made it her mission to discredit victims of the Shiny Happy People cult. She released a series of videos attacking Amazon Prime's "Shiny Happy People" documentary, and accused participants of lying about their experience in the cult. She has even secured backing from a production company to produce her own "rebuttal" documentary, "Shiny Slander."

But Davey Jackson has uncovered some disturbing information about Holly, which raise serious questions about her credibility and intentions.

Lindsey Williams and Chad Harris join the podcast to discuss Davey's discoveries and react to a trailer for Holly's forthcoming documentary.

Stay tuned for a surprise guest with close ties to Holly who reveals even more about her questionable history!

Follow on social media:
Lindsey Williams - @thecultchronicles
Chad Harris - @archradish85
Davey Jackson - @daveyjax 
Friends With Davey - @friendswithdavey

Check out Friends With Davey merch at www.friendswithdavey.com

Listen to Davey Jackson livestreaming with a new friend every Wednesday at 8:00PM CST.

Podcast audio available on Spotify, iTunes, and all streaming platforms.

episodes.title: Shiny Happy People Psychology | Friends With Davey - Dr. Kristen Casey
episodes.description:
The extreme impact of growing up in a cult were graphically documented in Prime Video's #1 series "Shiny Happy People." But what about the long term psychological consequences?

Dr. Kristen Casey is a clinical psychologist, specialized in trauma therapy, and talks to Davey Jackson about how his experiences in the Shiny Happy People cult may have shaped some of his behavior and thought patterns long after he left the cult.

DISCLAIMER: This podcast is not intended as advice or diagnosis and is not a substitute for therapy. If you are struggling with mental health issues please contact a medical professional.

Follow on social media:
Dr. Kristen Casey - @drkristencasey
Davey Jackson - @daveyjax  
Friends With Davey - @friendswithdavey

Check out Friends With Davey merch at www.friendswithdavey.com

Listen to Davey Jackson livestreaming with a new friend every Wednesday at 8:00PM CST.

Podcast audio available on Spotify, iTunes, and all streaming platforms.

episodes.title: Bootcamp In The Shiny Happy People Cult LIVE! | Friends With Davey - Timothy Baldridge
episodes.description:
One of the most notorious programs in the Shiny Happy People Cult was a paramilitary style training course at a remote compound in Texas. Families would send their teenage sons to the Air Land Emergency Resource Team (ALERT) for intensive physical training and religious indoctrination. 

Join the livestream as Davey Jackson talks to Timothy Baldridge about his experience in the Shiny Happy People Cult's ALERT program, how he survived bootcamp training, and eventually escaped the cult.

Listen to Davey Jackson livestreaming with a new friend every Wednesday at 8:00PM CST.

Podcast audio available on Spotify, iTunes, and all streaming platforms.

episodes.title: Shiny Happy People Troll + Matt Rife Drama - LIVE! | Friends With Davey
episodes.description:
Join the livestream with Davey Jackson as he addresses comments from Shiny Happy People Troll, Holly McLean. 

Holly (AKA Mommy Answer Lady) has downplayed accusations against the Shiny Happy People Cult and cult leader Bill Gothard, even going so far as to question the validity of survivors' stories. When Davey and other ex-cult members challenged Holly's narrative on the Friends With Davey podcast, she responded by commenting extensively on the YouTube episodes.

Davey also addresses the controversy surrounding Matt Rife and an "insensitive" joke he made on his Netflix stand up comedy special "Natural Selection."

episodes.title: Growing Up In The Shiny Happy People Cult | Friends With Davey - Chad Harris
episodes.description:
Chad Harris' family joined the Shiny Happy People cult when he was just 7 years old, after a doctor convinced his parents to attend a seminar with cult leader Bill Gothard.

Chad spent the next almost 20 years being indoctrinated and brainwashed with extreme fundamental Christian teachings before he finally found the truth and ultimately shared his experience on Prime Video's #1 documentary series, "Shiny Happy People."

Davey Jackson and Brice are also ex-members of the Shiny Happy People cult and discover with Chad that they all happened to attend the cult's annual conference in Knoxville, TN in the same year and witnessed one of the most infamous incidents in the cult's history!

Follow Chad on social media: @archradish

episodes.title: Surviving The Fundamental Christian Homeschool Movement | Friends With Davey - Taylor
episodes.description:
Taylor is a social media influencer and professional model, but her childhood in a fundamental Christian homeschool group was far from glamorous. Religious leaders like James Dobson and Focus On The Family shaped Taylor's upbringing until she finally escaped at 19 years old. 

The IBLP homeschool cult has received widespread attention since the release of Prime Video's #1 documentary "Shiny Happy People" but the impact of the fundamental Christian homeschool movement goes much deeper than just one organization.

Taylor shares her experience growing up in the world of homeschooling, modesty, courtship and purity culture as Davey relates to striking similarities in the Shiny Happy People cult.

Follow Taylor on social media:
IG - @kitkatbirdie  

Follow Davey on social media:
IG - @DaveyJax

episodes.title: The Cult Of Troubled Teens | Friends With Davey - Cami
episodes.description:
The Troubled Teens Industry was responsible for dozens of boarding-style reform schools all over the United States run by organizations like the Worldwide Association of Specialty Programs and Schools (WWASPS). That all changed few years ago, when several former students, including Paris Hilton and Kat Von D, came forward with allegations of extreme abuse at the schools.

Cami was a student at the notorious Spring Creek Lodge Academy for a year and a half and joins Davey Jackson to share her experience in The Cult Of Troubled Teens.

Follow Cami on social media:
IG - @WeWereProgrammed

episodes.title: Being A Mother In The Shiny Happy People Cult | Friends With Davey - Christine Faour
episodes.description:
The Shiny Happy People documentary told the stories of thousands of people who grew up in the oppressive and abusive environment of Bill Gothard's IBLP cult. 

Former cult members, Davey Jackson and Brice, talk to Christine Faour about her unique experience being a mother and raising her children in the Shiny Happy People cult. 

"Shiny Happy People" is Prime Video's #1 documentary, taking an in-depth look at the dark history of the Duggar Family (TLC's "19 Kids And Counting") and one of the most mysterious cults in America.

Learn more about Christine's journey by reading her book, "Behind The Dress" available on Amazon.

episodes.title: I Grew Up With 44 Siblings In A Polygamy Cult (Part 2) | Friends With Davey - Calvin Wayman
episodes.description:
Former polygamy cult member, Calvin Wayman, is back for Part 2 sharing his experience growing up in the Fundamental Mormon religion.

Calvin was raised by his father and 4 mothers along with 44 siblings in a Fundamental Mormon cult with close ties to Warren Jeffs, the convicted religious leader currently surviving life in prison.

Calvin explains how he made the difficult decision to turn his back on his religious upbringing and the painful experience of being shunned by his family and friends.

Follow Calvin on social media and check out his podcast “Cultured” premiering August 4th! Visit www.CulturedPod.com for more information.
Calvin's YouTube:  @officialcalvinwayman  
Calvin's IG: @calvinwayman

episodes.title: I Grew Up With 44 Siblings In A Polygamy Cult | Friends With Davey - Calvin Wayman
episodes.description:
Former polygamy cult member, Calvin Wayman, joins Davey Jackson to share his experience growing up in the Fundamental Mormon religion.

Calvin was raised by his father and 4 mothers along with 44 siblings in Salt Lake City, Utah. His childhood was shrouded in secrecy and hiding to avoid punishment from local authorities for his family's polygamist beliefs.

The cult also had close ties to Warren Jeffs' church in Colorado City, Arizona, and Calvin explains how Jeffs' arrest and imprisonment profoundly effected his family.

Follow Calvin on social media and check out his website www.CulturedPod.com!
Calvin's YouTube: @officialcalvinwayman

episodes.title: Confronting The Shiny Happy People Cult Leader with Brooke Arnold
episodes.description:
Brooke Arnold grew up in the Shiny Happy People cult and after years of battling childhood trauma and indoctrination, she finally decided to confront cult leader, Bill Gothard, face to face.

Brooke was a primary contributor on Prime Video's "Shiny Happy People" #1 documentary series. After separating from the IBLP cult she spent countless hours researching and compiling information on Bill Gothard, which was featured extensively in the documentary.

Follow Brooke on social media and visit her website www.TrippinWithBrookeArnold.com.
YouTube: @trippinwithbrookearnold

episodes.title: Surviving The Shiny Happy People Cult (Part 6) - Recovery | Friends With Davey
episodes.description:
Davey Jackson and Brice grew up in the Shiny Happy People Cult and spent years living under the strict rules of cult leader, Bill Gothard. They were both subjected to extensive brainwashing and abuse at the cult's compounds before finally escaping Gothard's influence. 

Davey and Brice talk about their experiences after leaving the IBLP cult, what it was like adjusting to life in the real world, and how they've recovered from the manipulation and exploitation of one of the most mysterious cults in America.

Plus, Davey talks to Brooke Arnold, one of the primary contributors to the Shiny Happy People documentary series, about her meeting with Bill Gothard.

The Shiny Happy People are coming to Austin, TX! Tickets now available for the LIVE podcast episode in Austin on July 26th with special appearances from the cast of Prime Video's recording-breaking documentary series, "Shiny Happy People," and audience Q&A!

Listen to Davey Jackson and Producer Josh, livestreaming with a new friend every Wednesday at 8:00PM CST.

episodes.title: Surviving The Shiny Happy People Cult (Part 5) - Disgraced | Friends With Davey
episodes.description:
Ex-members of the Shiny Happy People cult, Davey Jackson and Brice, discuss the scandals that finally exposed cult founder and spiritual leader, Bill Gothard.

Davey and Brice also take a look at what Gothard's been up to recently including a video of the disgraced cult leader being ambushed in his own driveway.

Plus, popular YouTuber and author, Noell Jett, joins Davey to talk about her experience growing up in the IBLP cult and how she overcame years of indoctrination and abuse to build the life of her dreams.

episodes.title: Exposing The Shiny Happy People Cult - Special Interview with Dr. John Cornish
episodes.description:
In an emotional interview, Davey Jackson talks to Dr. John Cornish, the man who helped expose the Shiny Happy People cult (aka IBLP).

Dr. Cornish co-founded Recovering Grace, a website dedicated to helping victims of the IBLP cult find support and recovery. As the Recovering Grace community grew, they discovered a series of scandals involving cult founder and leader, Bill Gothard. The group's allegations forced Gothard to leave the cult in disgrace.

Davey Jackson grew up in Gothard's IBLP cult and is taking an in-depth look at what life in the cult was really like in his podcast series, "Surviving The Shiny Happy People Cult."

Shiny Happy People is the #1 documentary series of all time on Prime Video and exposes the Duggar family’s involvement in one of America's most mysterious cults.

episodes.title: Surviving The Shiny Happy People Cult (Part 4) - Bootcamp | Friends With Davey
episodes.description:
The "Shiny Happy People" cult ruined the lives of thousands of people all over the world with intense brainwashing and exploitative tactics. Cult leader, Bill Gothard, established several programs designed to spread his gospel and control followers, including a paramilitary training center located in Big Sandy, TX.

Ex-cult members, Davey Jackson and Brice, take an in-depth look at two of Gothard's most notorious programs and share what it was like growing up in the Shiny Happy People cult.

PLUS Davey talks to the group who exposed years of scandals and coverups in the cult and forced Bill Gothard to leave in disgrace.

Listen to Davey Jackson and Producer Josh, livestreaming with a new friend every Wednesday at 8:00PM CST.

Podcast audio available on Spotify, iTunes, and all streaming platforms.

episodes.title: Surviving The Shiny Happy People Cult (Part 3) - Handmaid’s Tale | Friends With Davey

Former cult member, Grace, joins Davey to give her unique perspective on what it was like for a female growing up in the world of IBLP, Bill Gothard, and the Shiny Happy People cult.

Davey and his friend Brice (also a former cult member) explore the compounds that IBLP and cult founder, Bill Gothard, built all over the world to exploit followers. Brice shares his experience living at the "Training Centers" in Oklahoma and Australia and Davey remembers the time he was sent to the cult's most notorious compound in Indianapolis, IN.
